content.body: sideshowbarker: ok. I was thinking we could do a "group update" to present what has happened in HTML in the past year (or since we last gave an update at tpac). maybe a meeting could also be useful, maybe other WGs want to discuss things with us in person

content.body: …which sessions I guess would be 50 minutes each
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: …which sessions I guess would be 50 minutes each

content.body: but if we reckon we want more time than that, we might still be able to get something scheduled
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: but if we reckon we want more time than that, we might still be able to get something scheduled

content.body: the scheduling this year is done in half-days — 4 hour sessions rather than 8 hours or whatever it normally is — I guess in order to accommodate it being a “hybrid” thing where we expect many participants will be taking part remotely (and experience shows it’s impractical to expect hybrid meetings to actually work effectively if they are any longer than 4 hours or so max)
